text: I use 0w20. I follow manual book
Depend on engine temps. In the end the quality and what temp it can take without degrading is more important
yesterday my friend showed me why we use thicker oil in our old car using the curry from the prata shop
its because when the oil is too thin  it creates gaps
then engines that rebuild before  or had bearings changed  the gaps are bigger and not as precise as a stock engine
so the thicker oil fills these gaps
or at least thats what i understood from the explanation
Yeah honda fit manual oso said 0W20 but I seen the price is more expensive than 5W30
If u need such viscosity it is wise to either change often or use a synthetic that doesnt degrade easily
Im guessing fit engine runs hot? 110 oil temps normal?

The NC Miata was developed when Ford owned Mazda; to trim costs  Ford dictated that the car share a platform with Mazda's larger RX-8. The NC was thus noticeably bulkier than any previous Miata  and it's now widely viewed as a departure from form.
